NO BROKER FEES. Prism at Park Avenue South is a sensational new glass tower at Park Avenue South and 28th Street, poised to redefine the Manhattan skyline. Designed by architect Christian de Portzamparc, this extraordinary new high-rise provides an opportunity to live in what will be a new architectural landmark in New York City. Located steps from Madison Square Park and among celebrated neighborhoods including Gramercy Park, Union Square and NoMad, Prism provides a vibrant downtown lifestyle with world-class restaurants, parks, shopping, and convenient transportation options. Choose from luxury studio, one-, two-, and three-bedroom apartments and an array of all-inclusive, first-class amenities.

Zeckendorf Towers is a full service luxury condominium located in the heart of downtown M
anhattan. Being a stone’s throw away from major subway and bus lines, along with its proximity to popular neighborhoods, the Zeckendorf Towers is the perfect building to live in. 

The building offers FREE access to a health-club which features an aerobics room, a well equipped gym, a beautiful 60 foot pool, a jacuzzi , a sauna  and a sundeck with comfortable lounge chairs. Don't forget to sign up for the free yoga, pilates, and boxing classes that are offered through the health club as well!

As mentioned before, the building sits on top of the 14 Street - Union Square subway station. All your favorite subway lines including the L, N, Q, R, W, 4, 5, and 6 are minutes away from your door.

Feeling hungry after that subway ride? Well its incredibly easy to shop at some of the city’s best supermarkets which include The Food Emporium, Trader Joe's, and Whole Foods. If you want to buy fresh and local produce, you can always stop by the Union Square Green Market as well. All of these food options are a two minute walk from the building. 

And if you’re feeling like you want to eat out, you have some of NYC’s best restaurants around the corner. 

The Zeckendorf Towers is one of the most desirable buildings in New York City in one of the most desirable neighborhoods. Don’t miss your chance to become a part of an amazing community in the middle of all the hustle and bustle of the city that never sleeps.

Located in the heart of Williamsburg, 56N9 is just steps away from the most sought-after boutiques, bars, restaurants, clubs, and galleries. Just a four minute train ride to Manhattan, Williamsburg offers the best of both worlds by providing a quick and easy commute to work and serving as an oasis from the bustling city life. With trendy locations like Brooklyn Bowl, Smorgasburg, and Brooklyn Brewery, it’s no wonder this pop-culture darling has established itself as one of the hippest destinations in Brooklyn. A fusion of all cultures and vistas, Williamsburg’s free-spirited and carefree environment makes anyone feel right at home. Williamsburg is more than just a place to live; it’s a lifestyle.Stunning boutique residences with an array of unparalleled features and amenities that transcend the expectations of any modern city resident. The lofty and expansive layouts of 56 N 9th apartments complement its floor-to-ceiling windows with ceiling heights ranging from 10-12 feet. From state-of-the-art appliances to white oak flooring, 56 N 9th offers the most well-appointed apartments in all of Brooklyn.

* Listed rent is net effective rent, based on a gross rent of $6,850.00 and 3 months free on a 2 year lease.

A newly renovated 1 bedroom apartment right off Bell Blvd in a convenient spot only blocks away from the Long Island Railroad, restaurants, and bars. There is also a laundry room in the basement and parking is available in the back.

Designed by celebrated Canadian architect Karl Fischer, this 1 bedroom East Harlem apartment pays tribute to a modern welcoming sensibility with its sleek lines and  it's own private outdoor space.

Step into the lobby and experience a sophisticated calm that pervades the entire building. For your convenience, the virtual concierge safely stores any deliveries until you come home. Enjoy sunny afternoons on the south-facing roof deck and practice yoga under the cabana. Or exercise in the state-of-the-art gym overlooking a generous garden courtyard complete with Jacuzzi, half basketball court, gourmet BBQ grill and dining area. Furnished with a fireplace, long bar, and flat-screen TV, the communal Lounge invites you to host intimate social gatherings.

Inside this apartment, a polished and pleasing aesthetic is grounded in meticulous detailing, refined materials and intelligent use of space. Over 9-foot high ceilings and floor-to-ceiling windows expand the sense of openness, while solid oak floors draw a fluid path from room to room. The luxurious kitchen is equipped with stainless steel Jenn-Air appliances and gleaming Caesarstone countertops and backsplashes. A serene white tile and teak wood bathroom features a soaking tub and a waterfall shower head. And a Bosch washer and dryer adds additional convenience.

Within blocks of Central Park, Museum Mile, and the East River, this apartment sits in the heart of a vibrant welcoming neighbourhood replete with charming shops, cozy cafés, and a lively restaurant scene.

Williamsburg is no longer dependent on Manhattan. The Burg is a cultural incubator, where an energetic collective of new yorkers have inherited a creative haven, established by a hipster movement. So, L-train Woes ? No we don't need Manhattan anymore, and if we do, it won't be so bad to add a few minutes to a commute across the ferry during the summer, or G train to the 7 during snowy daysand the JMZ isn't far either.

The buildings dynamic architecture is reflected throughout the interiors that organically flow from indoor to outdoor living. Materials and construction have been carefully considered and selected for their resilience and environmental impact. Each aspect of the design has been thoughtfully planned to conserve water, reduce energy needs, and promote the wellness of residents while minimizing the impact on the environment.

 VIA 57 WEST offers premium rental residences that balance the excitement of the city and the tranquility of nature. Contact Amanda to see this or any apartment at 10 Montieth!

With todays social and technological paradigms in mind, 10 Montieth invites residents into a ground-breaking world of accessibility and connectivity, one that celebrates user experience and champions shared perspective. Encapsulating one full block in Brooklyns coveted Bushwick neighborhood, 10 Montieths distinct modular form holds studio, one, and two-bedroom apartments at affordable and market rates, each pixelating the buildings faade with cascading terraces. Here, living space extends beyond each apartments four walls with ample outdoor space: the sloping rooftop garden is primed for group activities or moments of solitude while the inner courtyards serve as unexpected urban retreats.

Where most residential buildings play it safe, 10 Montieth breaks the mold. The O-shaped height is lowered in key areas to increase sunlight exposure for the courtyard and interior facades while tethering the building to the community with a scaled down vertical footprint. Similarly, the sloped roof creates unique points of access from the top levels of the building and the structures shape allows for views of Manhattan from street-facing and inner courtyard apartments. A living, breathing canvas of expression for its residents and community, 10 Montieth is the ideal address for New Yorks next wave of visionaries.

560 State Street is a uniquely modern condominium located at the intersection of Brooklyn’s Boerum Hill, Park Slope, and Fort Greene neighborhoods. Anchored by its private, professionally landscaped courtyard, 560 State is welcoming for families, pet owners, commuters and all types of Brooklynites.

Transformed into apartments in the late 1980s, the building’s 38 spacious units are a mixture of floor-thru and duplexes. Each one boasts high ceilings, hardwood floors, large windows, and central air conditioning and heating. Since the building was converted to condominiums in 2005, apartments have been renovated and modernized by dedicated owners over the years.

Out in the courtyard, residents enjoy communal barbecue grills and ample seating for entertaining and lounging. At night, gas lamps illuminate the space and serve as reminders of the building’s 19th century past.

Home to such large attractions as Barclays Center, BAM, and Atlantic Mall, the neighborhoods around 560 State also celebrate the local flavor of Brooklyn — from casual takeout to Michelin-Star restaurants, sports bars to cocktail lounges, and hip boutiques to Target (not to mention the best bagels in the borough).

When venturing outside the neighborhood, Atlantic Terminal station is across the street, with 12 subway lines and the LIRR only steps away from the front door. Get to Midtown, FiDi, or Williamsburg all within an easy 25 minutes.

With its spacious apartment layouts and a great community vibe, 560 State is a residential oasis nestled within the best shopping, nightlife, and transportation Brooklyn has to offer.

With todays social and technological paradigms in mind, 10 Montieth invites residents into a ground-breaking world of accessibility and connectivity, one that celebrates user experience and champions shared perspective. Encapsulating one full block in Brooklyns coveted Bushwick neighborhood, 10 Montieths distinct modular form holds studio, one, and two-bedroom apartments at affordable and market rates, each pixelating the buildings faade with cascading terraces. Here, living space extends beyond each apartments four walls with ample outdoor space: the sloping rooftop garden is primed for group activities or moments of solitude while the inner courtyards serve as unexpected urban retreats.

Where most residential buildings play it safe, 10 Montieth breaks the mold. The O-shaped height is lowered in key areas to increase sunlight exposure for the courtyard and interior facades while tethering the building to the community with a scaled down vertical footprint. Similarly, the sloped roof creates unique points of access from the top levels of the building and the structures shape allows for views of Manhattan from street-facing and inner courtyard apartments. A living, breathing canvas of expression for its residents and community, 10 Montieth is the ideal address for New Yorks next wave of visionaries.

With todays social and technological paradigms in mind, 10 Montieth invites residents into a ground-breaking world of accessibility and connectivity, one that celebrates user experience and champions shared perspective. Encapsulating one full block in Brooklyns coveted Bushwick neighborhood, 10 Montieths distinct modular form holds studio, one, and two-bedroom apartments at affordable and market rates, each pixelating the buildings faade with cascading terraces. Here, living space extends beyond each apartments four walls with ample outdoor space: the sloping rooftop garden is primed for group activities or moments of solitude while the inner courtyards serve as unexpected urban retreats.

Where most residential buildings play it safe, 10 Montieth breaks the mold. The O-shaped height is lowered in key areas to increase sunlight exposure for the courtyard and interior facades while tethering the building to the community with a scaled down vertical footprint. Similarly, the sloped roof creates unique points of access from the top levels of the building and the structures shape allows for views of Manhattan from street-facing and inner courtyard apartments. A living, breathing canvas of expression for its residents and community, 10 Montieth is the ideal address for New Yorks next wave of visionaries.

THE PROPERTY: This industrial beauty stands on the corner of Manhattan Avenue & Skillman Ave just a couple blocks from the Lorimer L/G Trains. The 6 floor structure was built in 1910 and gutted just a few years ago, keeping many of it's original details, exposed piping, brick, and woodwork. 26 lofts have been carved out of the interior which includes elevators, laundry room, bicycle storage, gym facility, courtyard, and rooftop deck with 360 degree views. The property is surrounded by trees on a quite intersection, steps away from Graham Ave, Metropolitan Ave, and some of the area's top restaurants & bars (we really love the Mexican Eats at Mesa Coyocan, fish at Sel de Mar, and cocktails at The Richardson).

OUR OPINION: The lofts are timeless. We love the wide plank Raw Oak Flooring that has been installed throughout all the units and hallways and the exposed beveled concrete ceiling with piping is very cool. This particular unit houses roughly 725sqft of living-space. The ceiling is about 12ft high. The glass french door division can be removed. We believe this is a great apartment. we would knock down the wall and turn it into one large open Loft.

66 Rockwell offers luxury in house valet service for the Residence. Wash & Fold, Dry Cleaning and packages right to your door and delivered into your home if you prefer. Services available also include, expert tailoring, same day pressing, organic dry cleaning and housekeeping.

Lifestyle:
* Sky Lounge: 
When you are ready to unwind, Rockwell offers the exclusive EOS Club. Members enjoy access to the Sky Lounge and Sky Deck showcasing a panoramic view of Downtown Brooklyn, the East River and the Manhattan Skyline. Indulge in the ambiance as the lounge music sets the mood against the glow of the two-way fireplace. After the sun sets the lounge becomes even more irresistible as the unique LED ceiling begins to come to life in color bringing the NY evening to life. 

* EOS Fit:
The EOS Gym features weekly classes which include, Yoga, Dance Fitness, Full Body Conditioning, Stretch and Core Strengthening and More, all from The Mark Morris Dance Group. In addition, Kickboxing classes are held by instructors from Brooklyn Martial Arts.

* EOS Play:
The game room offers a pool and an air hockey table, foosball tables and an Arcade room with classic video games all set to free play. 

* Zen Garden:
Members have access to large size BBQ grills, a dining table, ping pong tables and plenty of patio furniture which make this area feel like your suburban backyard. A large screening wall has been host to our popular summer movie nights. 

* EOS Community:
Only at Rockwell will you experience a social interactive community. EOS club events included events such as, Game Night and Entertainment, cooking classes, mixology, wellness events, happy hours, movie screenings and much more. 

* EOS Coffee Kiosk:
The coffee shop located in the EOS Lounge serves delicious coffees, espressos and teas from The Brooklyn Roasting Company. Text your order and our trained baristas will have your beverage of choice ready when you arrive. Members also have access to the clubs' bike share located right in front of Rockwell, reserved only for EOS members. The book club, sponsored by the beloved neighborhood Greenlight Book Store, welcomes new members.

Introducing one of the largest and most sought-after co-op buildings in all of Greenwich Village, 250 Mercer Street. Having recently undergone a major renovation, the building now features brand new elevators, carpeted hallways with designer lighting, and will have a completely renovated lobby by mid-summer 2017. This historic multi-building complex of four towers (A-D) was formerly a cast iron factory and was originally built in 1890. The building was converted from commercial to residential in 1979 when it debuted with 275 rental apartments, and later became a co-op in 1986. The building’s industrial origins and unique original detail afford residents the advantages of loft-like layouts, 12- to 16-foot ceilings and classic city views. What separates this co-op from the rest is also the flexible, condo-style sublet policy. This extremely liberal co-op also allows pets, pieds-a-terre, co-purchasing, and guarantors. Amenities at this prewar co-op include a full-time doorman, live-in super, furnished courtyard and roof deck, bicycle storage, and laundry facilities. Ideally located in the center of trendy NoHo between West 3rd and 4th streets, 250 Mercer is a short distance to Washington Square Park and only blocks from some of the city’s best shopping and restaurants in SoHo, Nolita, and West Village. Building is pet friendly for owners only not renters.

A former chocolate factory turned authentic loft community, The Chocolate Factory Lofts boasts expansive, unique layouts, contemporary finishes and rustic industrial charm. Modern finishes blend seamlessly with original factory fixtures such as hardwood flooring, exposed brick walls, reclaimed wood beams and soaring 12' ceilings. In addition, the building also features a stunning roof deck with Manhattan skyline views, a landscaped courtyard, part-time doorman, on-site laundry and garage parking. Located in the historic and artistic Wallabout District of Clinton Hill between Williamsburg and Dumbo, one of Brooklyn's most alluring neighborhoods and just a block from the Brooklyn Navy Yard, The Chocolate Factory boasts retail and business space on site and is surrounded by renowned restaurants, trendy cafes, gourmet grocers and hip boutiques. Transportation options include the Clinton/Washington G train, multiple bus lines to the A,C,F,B and Q trains and a Citi Bike station just outside of the front door. Call today to see these amazing lofts!

Fees required for: Parking, CKO Kickboxing, Wet Lounge

63 Wall Street combines two of the finest buildings in Lower Manhattan to provide a New York living experience unlike any other. Nestled in the heart of Manhattan's historic Financial District, 63 Wall Street is unique in its perfect harmony of classic form and modern construction.

From a resident-only speakeasy to a private fitness center and a sundeck, the building provides a wide array of amenities that combine the convenience of a high-end hotel with the comforts of home. Luxury amenities such as valet, housekeeping and concierge services, are complemented by the attentive front staff, all committed to providing assistance for your unique needs.

A junior one bedroom with a place for everything and everything in its place!  Stroll along one of the nicest tree lined residential blocks in the heart of historic Park Slope, sashay through the original iron work gate, and up one short flight to your new pad in a quintessential brick row home.   If you're looking for excellent storage for all your belongings,  here it is!   Three large south facing windows greet you with abundant light streaming into the open plan living/dining/ kitchen space straight ahead.  The kitchen allows for your every gastronomical adventure with a 30 inch gas range, fridge, full size dishwasher, ample granite counters and cabinetry where you can put away all your pots, pans, utensils, and dishes.   There are ten cabinets and six kitchen drawers --unusual in a junior one.  Classic exposed brick and ceiling fan complete the charming picture!  
Segue into the 12'6 x 8'6  private sleep alcove, large enough for a Queen and a dresser, lined with closets, built in shelves, and overhead storage.  At the apt entrance are a coat closet and an additional walk in closet large enough to be fitted with a desk/ work station, complete with designated lighting and electric wall outlet.  There are five closets total--unusual for a starter apartment.    
The modern bath with white subway tile, vanity, and large walk in shower is centrally located so your guests need not pass thru your bedroom to use the bathroom.    Convenience and storage galore in addition to charm!  Pets on approval.

Though becoming popular with a younger crowd, Bay Ridge remains a haven for long-term residents, local businesses and working-class families. Renters pushed out of Park Slope find a similar community vibe here, at a decidedly lower price.

This is your next rental. It's a recently renovated, quiet, spacious, two bedroom plus the Midwood area is terrific. I recommend you schedule a viewing right away.
The rental's highlights include hardwood floors throughout, western exposure, and sound proof, thermal, large windows. Nice touches add to the apartment's likable feel including high ceilings.
The unit has onsite laundry. The apartment also has dimmer controlled and recessed lighting. The apt has plenty of sunlight to brighten up the space. In addition to the above, the apartment comes with heat/hot included.
For your home-cooked meals, the eat-in kitchen was recently renovated and has a window that opens, a galley layout, tile flooring, and new countertops. It has a gas range, high-end appliances, a gas oven, a full-sized fridge, and plenty of storage.
The bedroom has hardwood flooring, a window that opens, and good storage. The bedroom is large enough to have room for a king sized bed.
Inside the recently renovated bathroom you'll find good storage, a standard tub, a medicine cabinet, and a standard shower. A window that opens in the bathroom is a nice addition.
It's rare in NYC, at this price range, to find a building that's well maintained, loved by tenants, rarely available, and leasing up fast. This building is exactly that. It's worth noting the building features a live-in super, security cameras, a front door buzzer, on street parking, and clean and lighted hallways.
For additional information and to schedule an immediate viewing, contact me at your earliest convenience.

This beautiful multi-level loft-like penthouse apartment, sitting high atop the iconic Pythian Condominium building among the brightly painted gargoyles and turrets, is in mint condition following a years-long transformative and total renovation. Sunlight and open cityscapes abound throughout this home with three exposures (S, W, N) along with a total of three separate outdoor spaces -- two terraces and a balcony. Sunlight and open cityscapes abound throughout this home with three exposures (S, W, N) along with a total of three separate outdoor spaces -- two terraces and a balcony. With two large living areas and a palatial entry gallery, this 2 bedroom and 2 bath space has all the room you could desire for effortless living and entertaining. PHD has approximately 2,143 SF interior and 660 SF exterior. No hyperbole here -- you really must see this one to fall in love! Entering through the private-keyed elevator on the upper level, the breadth of the apartment greets you with its inviting expansive gallery including 16-foot super-high ceilings, nuanced with interesting artwork and notable OLampia lighting. This level is the primary living space with a windowed open kitchen, including Miele appliances, with a W/D unit tucked away in a contained step-in closet. As well, with this integrated Kitchen, the appliances are hidden by surfaces matching the cabinetry. The rectangular dining area flows from here along a wall with multiple windows into the L-shaped main living area, which includes a centerpiece black marble fireplace. Following up a half-level is the spectacular, bright and large 2nd living area library with its beautiful walnut floors (also throughout the entire apartment) that culminates onto the largest of the terraces. Equipped with outdoor furniture, this terrace maintains a beautiful serenity both day and night. Down the lit-steps stairway from the main level entrance gallery, the lower level could also be called the sleeping level. With the second separate keyed entry from the building hallway, this level contains both the owner's bedroom and the second bedroom, each with its own en-suite bathroom, as well as its own glass-door access to the second terrace. The owner's bedroom also has two walk-in closets and a built-in bed with nightstands and reading lights. The second bedroom also has two closets, consisting of the full length of one wall. Of note, the main owner's bedroom walk-in closet is built within an exterior building turret topped with a huge round skylight that creates a quite zen atmosphere. It also has fully built-in hardwood hanger spaces, shelves and mirrors. A fully-wired integrated audio/security system is smart-phone controlled. The Pythian is a legendary UWS building originally built in 1926 as a temple for the Knights of Pythias and subsequently converted into a condominium in 1983. Architecturally, it is highly regarded as a blockbuster synthesis of Egyptian, Babylonian and Assyrian motifs evoking the grandeur of D. W. Griffith's Babylonian movie set for his 1916 film 'Intolerance'. The Pythian Temple's ground-floor colonnade, with Assyrian-type heads, is centered on a brilliantly glazed blue terra-cotta entry pavilion. The middle section steps back at about 100 feet up, with four seated Pharaonic figures, similar to those of Ramses II at Abu Simbel. Two more setbacks rise to a highly colored Egyptian-style colonnade, and to giant urns carried by teams of yellow, red and green oxen. Spectacular! Pets Allowed. Available Furnished, Partially Furnished, or Unfurnished.

Perched atop the South West corner of McCarren Park rests Ilona. The Art Deco design is reminiscent of the bold grandeur New York is famous for, with elements inspired by loft living that harken back to the Williamsburg of days past. From every angle the building is striking, featuring oversized European casement windows with curved glass accents, intricate masonry work, and raw iron details. The interiors exude class with custom kitchen cabinetry, quartz countertops, ebony oak flooring, as well as subway and penny tiled bathrooms. The homes, offered in studio, one, two, and three bedroom layouts, are all oversized with most afforded Park views and incomparable natural light. The Penthouse collection features 10ft. ceiling heights combined with 9ft. french doors leading to private terraces that overlook McCarren Park and the iconic NYC skyline. Our Town homes offer the best of both worlds, with the discretion of private entrances and backyards, coupled with the amenities of a full service boutique building. Amenities at The Park Ilona include, attended lobby with package room, bike and private storage spaces, a state of the art fitness center with yoga studio, resident lounge with wet bar and morning coffee, private rooftop cabanas, and secure underground garage parking. Verizon Fios wired with free wifi in common areas, and of course we are pet friendly!

The very first lease offering at Soori High Line – where custom craft, luxury and modern innovation are inseparable – is now available. 7D is a regal duplex situated on the highest available floor of the Pool Residences, and offers five bedrooms and five baths over an impressive 3,586 SF of interior space. Enter graciously via private elevator into a double-height living room with soaring ceiling height of 18’, all framed by floor-to-ceiling windows flooding the room with sun-beaming light. Interiors include Augsburg oak paneled walls and a gas fireplace with floating Nero Marquina marble slab hearth. Adding to the spirit of lavish entertaining and personal respite, enjoy immediate access to the enclosed and heated saltwater swimming pool surrounded by solid timber decking. 

Centrally positioned on the principal level, the Poliform-Varenna chef’s kitchen sports Bavarian Spessart oak and high-gloss lacquer cabinetry, Caesarstone Pietra Grey countertops and backsplash. The fully-integrated Miele and Subzero appliance package comprises convection, steam and speed ovens, warming drawers, a wine cooler and Poliform-Varenna vented hood.

Situated discreetly in the rear wing of the home, a south-facing master bedroom suite has its own private terrace, a nearly 15’ deep outfitted walk-in-closet, and a double-height, five-fixture bathroom clad in Perlado Beige marble, all overlooking the private pool. Then on the upper floor, find generously proportioned bedroom suites, each with private bath, along with a secondary south-facing terrace and expansive media room. Direct elevator access is also provided to this floor. 

Meticulously crafted for the most discerning audience, the residence boasts honed, radiant-heated Azul Grey limestone floors in all living areas, 7” wide Bavarian Spessart oak flooring in the bedrooms, and floating walls and ceilings throughout. 

Ensuring the highest possible standards for its residents are always met, Soori High Line has collaborated with Fitlore, New York’s leading private wellness concierge. Full-time staff, a state-of-the-art fitness and spa suite with on demand services, yoga and Pilates studios, a resident’s lounge and storage facilities are all at your disposal. Private parking is also included. 

Soori High Line stands as a monumental contribution to the rich architectural fabric of West Chelsea and is located just one block from the High Line and Hudson Yards. Enjoy the wonders of both areas, where world-class dining, fine galleries and retailers, Chelsea Piers, cultural institutions and outdoor splendor are all within immediate reach. And Soori Highline's place within the nexus of Architecture as ART – positioned amongst such dignitaries as Norman Foster, Zaha Hadid, Issey Weinfeld, Shigeru Ban, Annabella Selfdorf , Robert A.M. Stern, and Bjarke Engels will guarantee iconic sustainability.

Spectacular 1 bed/1 bath corner unit available. Tons of light. Rarely available. Over 1200 square feet. 
Originally built in 1857 as a luxurious department store for Arnold, Constable & Company, the building was landmarked as part of the Soho Cast Iron District in 1978. When it opened, the store, then known as the Marble House, offered silk, imported hand-made lace, bridal veils and other accoutrements for the lady about town, and was patronized by the leading families of the city. 

Now 150 years later, The Constable has been meticulously restored revealing original cast-iron columns, exposed brick and soaring ceilings with hewn beams. Enhancing this preservation of historic detail, The Constable's newly renovated lofts also feature wide plank oak floors, open kitchens, a fully-vented washer & dryer in each residence, and double-glazed, arched windows.

SPONSOR UNIT, NO BOARD APPROVAL. IMMEDIATE OCCUPANCY. Overlooking "Block Beautiful," Apartment 2G is a bright, south facing, two-room one-bedroom apartment with an updated kitchen and bath. The apartment is available for a one or more year lease starting September 1, 2018. Constructed in 1903 as the Hotel Irving, the building joined a unique enclave of elegant townhouses and buildings surrounding Manhattan's only private park. 26 Gramercy Park South runs through the block and has entrances and exits on both 19th and 20th streets. Apartment 5G is on the 19th Street side of the building. Gramercy Park is a globally recognized location, evoking the creativity, history, wealth and enduring elegance of New York City. Everything you want is here, starting with an oasis of calm in the middle of Manhattan. Nearby Union Square has an unrivaled farmers' market, transportation, and seasonal activities. Renowned restaurants and cafes like Maialino, Casa Mono, 71 Irving, and Gramercy Tavern are exceptional and as busy as ever. High-minded culture can be found at the National Arts Club, and the trendy Rose Room at the Gramercy Park Hotel is buzzing on the north side of the park. Nearby side streets feature small boutiques, while major commercial corridors have everything you need.There is a full-time staff of three, which includes a part-time doorman (evenings and weekends), a superintendent, and a porter. Guarantors and pets are welcome on a case-by-case basis. Additionally, there is central laundry.

A beautiful, large 1 bedroom apartment is on the market beginning September 1 (date flexible). Located right on Broadway, this 27th floor unit of Carnegie Mews apartment is a commuter’s dream in a prime location, with stunning views of the city and great amenities.

Apartment Features:

Location:

* Laundry: Card operated laundry room in the basement with approximately 50 washers/dryers. I’ve never had to wait in all my time living here.
* Misc: Dry cleaning services and indoor car parking available for extra cost. Separate freight elevator with trolleys for easy movement of furniture or heavy items.

Now this is Bushwick!
Welcome to The Rheingold, the new standard of luxury living in Bushwick. No longer riding the coattails of its neighbors to the North & West, The Rheingold puts Bushwick on the map with a luxurious, resort style building. Occupying a full square block, on the site of the former Rheingold Brewery, this building features 500 units spread out amongst 8 floors.
The units were designed to maximize your living space and to provide the latest in comfort, design & technology. Large windows and open interiors allow for bright and cheerful layouts. Units are equipped with efficient cooling & heating systems, Built-In Bluetooth speakers and video intercom systems. Finished with wide-plank white oak flooring, designer tiles, high ceilings and ample closet space, the wide variety of floorplans means that there is something for everyone. Most units feature private outdoor space. Kitchens feature stainless steel appliances, soft-close glass cabinetry and sparkling porcelain backsplashes. The bathrooms are outfitted with deep-soaking tubs, sleek chrome fittings, beautiful tiles and medicine cabinets.
With over 70,000 square feet of outdoor space, 41 unique amenities, and a concierge service to handle all your needs, you may never have to leave the building. Work from home? If not, you may be tempted to start! The Rheingold offers a business center, conference rooms, laundry room, creative studios, fitness center and a scrumptious cafeteria. Grab a cup of coffee on your way to work or snack on a croissant as you work from the comfort of your urban oasis. Enjoy four seasons of NY weather in one of the large, landscaped outdoor spaces. Trees, flowers and fountains provide the backdrop on the lower courtyards. Excellent views of NYC, ample lounge space and waterfalls provide the zen factor on the common roofdeck. Test your fear of heights on the rooftop sky-bridge or on the climbing wall in the fitness center. Your four legged friends want to join in the fun? Bring them to the dog run or pet spa. Love to entertain? The building offers many areas that can be reserved for private events or parties including a music studio, photo studio, paint studio, movie screening room and private roof party area.
Home to some of Brooklyn’s best new restaurants, bars and nightlife, Bushwick offers all of the conveniences that NYC has to offer, right at your fingertips. You won’t have to go far for nightly entertainment, Bushwick is home to unrivaled arts, theater and music scenes, many located in former warehouses, a reminder of the neighborhood’s industrial past.
Getting around Brooklyn or into Manhattan is a breeze with the variety of convenient transportation options. Ditch those L train blues with the J/M/Z trains just minutes away at the Myrtle Avenue stop. The L train at Morgan Avenue is less than half mile away, the B57 is right around the corner & there is a Citi Bike station just a few blocks away.

With a spacious living room and a state of the art kitchen with high-end appliances, a microwave, dishwasher, sprawling counters, and a breakfast bar, this unit is ready for relaxing or entertaining. You'll also find two huge bedrooms, the master boasting double exposure and incredible closet space. Both bathrooms are fitted with upscale finishes and fixtures. There is even an in-unit washer/dryer for convenience. Welcome to your ultra-modern dream home in the sky at this sleek two-bedroom, two-bathroom condo located in The Edge, Williamsburg's most sought-after luxury building. Here you'll find glorious views and light, airy sunshine set alongside premium finishes and bountiful amenities. From the moment you enter the 1,110-square- foot home's great room, you'll be drawn to the floor-to-ceiling windows framing unbeatable views of the Manhattan skyline on both western and southern exposures. The expansive 28-foot by 13-foot space is anchored on one end by a 90-square- foot private balcony, and on the other by a sleek, modern kitchen that any chef would envy, making this a wonderful layout for entertaining. The windowed kitchen features gleaming white lacquered cabinetry, top-of-the-line integrated appliances and a massive white quartz island, providing ample prep space and convenient breakfast bar seating. In the master bedroom, you'll find more striking west-facing city views, an oversized closet and a vibrant en suite bathroom lined with gorgeous tile work and featuring a double-sink vanity, large bath, and separate glass shower. The home's split-bedroom layout places the second large bedroom on the opposite side of the home, adjacent to the second full bathroom, providing ideal privacy. High ceilings and white oak floors run throughout the home, and the gracious foyer includes another large closet and in-unit washer/dryer the ultimate convenience.

The EDGE is Williamsburg's most coveted condominium building, with an impressive amenity package that includes 24hr doorman and staff, all-season swimming pool, sauna, steam room, jacuzzi, full-size indoor basketball court, 30-seat movie screening rooms, state-of-the-art fitness centers with classes, lounge with fireplace, free WIFI and billiards, two rooftop decks with stunning 360-degree views, community grill, spa treatment rooms, children's playroom and on-site parking garage with Zip-Car.

Other standout features at The EDGE in Williamsburg include a great waterfront location with city views and proximity to numerous parks, transportation (the L, G J, M and Z trains and East River Ferry), restaurants, shopping, and nightlife. With so many great attributes, this is your chance to live in one of the most sought-after buildings in Brooklyn.

The Rheingold in Bushwick Brooklyn: Occupying a full city block on the site of the legendary Rheingold Brewery, this sloping 8 story building with its signature multicolored window frames, a lushly landscaped roof and three interior courtyards features a bevy of amenities, and an award winning design team, setting a new standard for living in New York's most dynamic and current neighborhood.
A short distance to JMZ trains at Flushing and Myrtle Aves and the L train at Morgan Ave. 

Apartments have gorgeous design features throughout, floor to ceiling windows, stylish accents and lighting.
Kitchens with stone counters, top of the line appliances including dishwashers and microwaves, and beautiful cabinets.
Relax in your spa like bathroom with deep soaking tub, beautiful tile backsplashes and lighting, and plenty of storage

Here, living space extends beyond each apartments four walls with ample outdoor space: the sloping rooftop garden is primed for group activities or moments of solitude while the inner courtyards serve as unexpected urban retreats.

Amenities include gym, climbing wall, squash courts, yoga room, business center, incredible cinema room, rooms for private parties and gatherings, art and music studios, game rooms, kids playroom/nursery, spa services, sauna and steam room, 24/7 doorman and concierge services in the stunningly gorgeous bi-level lobby.
Indoor garage parking and bicycle storage and laundry facilities onsite.

Where most residential buildings play it safe, 10 Montieth breaks the mold. The O-shaped height is lowered in key areas to increase sunlight exposure for the courtyard and interior facades while tethering the building to the community with a scaled down vertical footprint. Similarly, the sloped roof creates unique points of access from the top levels of the building and the structures shape allows for views of Manhattan from street-facing and inner courtyard apartments. A living, breathing canvas of expression for its residents and community, 10 Montieth is the ideal address for New Yorks next wave of visionaries.

Lobby is designed with marble mosaic tile and thassos stone, custom brass chandelier, and intricate wood detailing throughout. 24-hour attended lobby, lifestyle concierge services, and landscaped roofdeck complete the amenities.

A magical SHORT TERM AND FURNISHED RENTAL (until March 1, 2019), in the Warren Place Mews, a hidden gem located in a lush English Garden between Warren and Baltic Streets. There are six fabulous rooms, two separate entrances and a charming cobblestone patio for entertaining. A marvelous custom kitchen with old world style AGA stove, Subzero fridge + half fridge + wine cooler and a full dining room grace the garden level. A living room with mantled wood burning fireplace, vintage crystal chandelier, a second bedroom or library featuring rich wood shelving and wall panels and a half bath make up the main level. A fabulous master bedroom suite with a spa-like windowed bath that includes a claw foot cast iron enamel soaking tub, tiled steam shower with marble bench, heated brass towel rack and speakers are found on the upper level. This home includes a unique addition which does not exist in any of the other landmarked Mews homes - a special stair replete with oak treads to a very private deck that opens up the space and creates extra light and beautiful views. A center staircase with skylight above keeps this home sunny all day long and connects the three luxurious floors of living space and the outdoor space. Nothing has been spared in this incredible renovation- vintage lighting throughout, Lefroy Brooks fixtures, central air and heat, authentic gas lighting on the roof terrace, reclaimed oak floors and solid pine doors with antique brass fixtures, and washer/dryer. F & G station a short walk away and 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, and R trains s a half mile away. Close to delicious dining, cinemas and located in one of the most charming brownstone neighborhoods in Brooklyn.

240 Central Park South was built in 1941 and designed by Mayer & Whittlesey, each of the homes was carefully crafted to maximize light and air. Recognizing this extraordinary architecture, the property was designated an official New York City landmark and is the only fully restored landmark rental residence on Columbus Circle. 240 Central Park South features stunning units. a 24 hour concierge, a fitness center, as well as several shops, cafes and an award-winning restaurant. The building also offers a rooftop lounge and deck overlooking the park.

240 Central Park South sits at the crossroads of distinguished landmarks and vibrant neighborhoods with unrivaled proximity to Central Park and Columbus Circle. At your doorstep are the seasonal hues and great expanse of Central Park, award-winning restaurants, luxury retail and Broadway theaters. Lincoln Center, Carnegie Hall and The Museum of Modern Art are just a few of the renowned institutions that call this neighborhood home. 240 Central Park South is located along ten different subway lines, providing convenient access to all of New York City.

We have a full variety of floor plans with everything from spacious studios up to expansive three bedroom homes. Each home has unique features: Some offer wood-burning fireplaces, unparalleled views of Central Park, washers and dryers and private terraces. Interiors are regularly fully renovated with modern designer kitchens and bathrooms.

Life’s never far from your doorstep in Manhattan, but at The Rollins, it’s closer than ever. Imagine living in a place where diverse shops, eateries, parks, entertainment, and cultural attractions are all just an elevator ride away. At The Rollins, located at 145 Clinton Street, residents will be among the first renters to move into the highly anticipated Essex Crossing development, seamlessly fitting in with the essence of the Lower East Side.

The building comes fully equipped with first-class amenities including an attended lobby, concierge service, a resident’s lounge with billiards and shuffleboard tables, a reservable private dining space and meeting room, TV lounge, built in banquette, and work stations. Outdoor spaces feature a rooftop terrace lounge seating throughout, dining tables, grills, and sweeping views of Manhattan. Additional outdoor space includes a residents’ elevated garden terrace and a public landscaped plaza just outside the lobby. The fully equipped state-of-the-art fitness center features Peloton bikes, a Wellbeats studio with on-demand fitness classes, and Activ Virtual Personal Trainer. The building is also pet friendly and features a pet spa, along with a children’s playroom and bicycle storage.

Renters can look forward to residences that include white oak flooring, double pane windows, quartz countertops, European stainless-steel appliances, Grohe bathroom fixtures, and Bosch washers and dryers. Residents will also have the convenient access just downstairs to Trader Joe’s and Target, which are expected to open in the building’s retail space in 2018.

Unit 7I is a three bedroom, two full bath with 1337 interior sf and a huge 337sf terrace open to the sky. Built in 2016, the Marx is a boutique condominium at the border of LIC and Astoria, located across from Kaufman Astoria Studios (one of the longest functioning film and television production centers and home to Sesame Street and Orange Is The New Black) and Museum of The Moving Image. 250 West Street,  the monumental former warehouse built in 1906, is located in the heart of Tribeca's historic landmark district. The warehouse building was transformed into a unique collection of 106 luxury condominium residences by developer El Ad Group and designed by GNA Architects. Overlooking the Hudson River and Hudson River Park's Piers 25 and 26, offering activities including, a children's playground, a miniature golf course, beach volleyball courts and more, the building's majestic exterior was returned to its early 20th century origins including two magnificent iron gates and the restorations of its cornice, arched windows and grand entryways. Enter through the magnificent lobby with separate library lounge. In addition to its huge size and soaring height, the lobby ends at an exquisite window wall that looks onto a beautifully designed and unique 61-foot pool and lounge. There are women's & men's changing rooms showers & saunas. The two-level amenity areas also include a state-of-the-art fitness center and a delightful children's playroom To complete this amenity package, 250 West also offers a 5000 sq ft common roof terrace with panoramic views, sundeck, lounge and dining area.
Thank you for looking!

Green By Design. No Fee Luxury Rentals 
Located in Downtown Manhattans most desirable waterfront neighborhood, Battery Park City, The Verdesian defines luxury, green living. At The Verdesian, our commitment to smarter living allows you to enjoy a healthier lifestyle while making a positive impact on our planet. Rising 26 stories, The Verdesian is the first LEED Platinum high-rise residential rental building in the nation and has become an important model for green construction around the world. Consisting of elegantly appointed studio- three bedroom homes, residences offer a blend of sophistication and sustainability. All environmentally sound apartments feature expansive layouts, naturally harvested building materials and innovative design features, providing abundant light, cleaner air, filtered water, and greater energy efficiency. 
Residents of The Verdesian enjoy unparalleled lifestyle services and amenities. Building amenities include 24-hour concierge service, landscaped roof terrace with organic herb gardens, childrens playroom featuring classes hosted by Creative Play, residents fitness center with complimentary daily classes and on-site parking with electric vehicle charging stations.

Clinton is trendy among those looking for a diverse place that still captures the history of New York. Now a haven for young professionals, actors, and writers, particularly ones who work in the Theater district, and is known for a high concentration of excellent and diverse restaurants, as well as some of the best bars and night spots in Manhattan. Clinton witnessed a construction boom over the past decade and because of that, there are many high-end luxury buildings and businesses that cater to those with exquisite taste. Separated from the Theater District by quiet, tree-lined streets, on street parking and much to do for locals, the HeII's Kitchen/Clinton area is unique. Where neighbors wave to neighbors and friendly local acquaintances nod and say hello, you'll feel very much at home here. Virtually every subway line in the city runs through the station at Times Square. Clinton residents are truly an eclectic mix of middle income and upper-class New Yorkers.

THE LOCATION: 
Uptown Chelsea in the making, this booming village per excellence offers the quietude of an exclusively residential area, the light and open skies of a severely protected historic neighborhood, and the exciting buzz of some of the best cafes and restaurants the City has to offer. We no longer settle for Harlem, we dream of it... irreversibly. 
These very blocks offer the most cultural and up-and-coming vibe in Manhattan today. At the heart of Central Harlem, an ever-more fun and trendy constellation of new Art-Galleries (st Striver's Row), wine clubs, European cafes and gourmet restaurants pop up for your amazement.
Enjoy all services and shopping on ACP and Lenox boulevards, at the very pulse of a trendy new restaurant at every season (Walk to Belle Harlem, A MUST, to unleash cultural and culinary pleasures. They are booked up? The Red Rooster should take you, Sylvia's, La Maison, Chocolate, L'Embassade, and a bit further North: ROKC for Ramen, best oysters and cocktails; Pulled Noodles' The Grange with its Jazz brunches; Chipped Cup caf; Bono Trattoria; Hogshead Tavern; $2 Everything is the best breakfast in town; Sweet Chef pastry shop for the real sweet-potato pie), Fairway Market on 132nd, and to make the dream practical too, transportation only two block away takes you Midtown within 15 Minutes. 
If you like to bike, discover up on 145th and the Hudson, Riverbank State Park with its double-Olympic swimming pool for $2 entry fee!, tennis and basketball courts, ice skating rink, running track and picnic areas.
All the way West, the Hudson River Greenway is the perfect JOG, skate or bike stroll onto the romantic, uninterrupted 11 miles of stunning paths from Battery Park to the Little Red Lighthouse underneath the George Washington Bridge; enjoy newly designed piers, restaurants, and the healthiest green New Yorkers!

Two luxury residential towers soar high above Manhattan's downtown neighborhood, offering a refreshing escape from the world's most vibrant city. Two Gold is the perfect choice for those with higher expectations. With its grand tower soaring 51-stories and adjoining 'sister tower rising 26-stories, Two Gold Street is located in the heart of the new Downtown. Designed by Avinash Malhotra architects, with amenity design by the Rockwell Group, 2 Gold offers an array of studio, one, two, and three bedroom apartments. 

Two Gold provides a well-deserved escape with an amenity package designed to help release tension, even for those in high-stress jobs. From elegant common spaces with custom furniture, to a fully equipped gym with the very latest in cardio machines, down to our heated lap-pool and 9000 sq. ft. rooftop terrace, all amenities are designed to provide the ultimate downtime experience. Additional amenities and services include 24-hour concierge service, club room with full-sized billiards table, playroom, bicycle storage and on-site parking garage.
Situated in the one of the city's oldest and historical thoroughfares, where New York City began, this dynamic neighborhood offers an exciting mix of green spaces, boutique shops, A-list bars, Michelin starred restaurants, markets, movie theaters, live music venues, museums and galleries. Whether you seek a new adventure at Governor's Island or like to people watch on the quaint cobblestone block of Stone Street, this is the neighborhood for you.

Please contact Justin Duffy to arrange your private tour.

With todays social and technological paradigms in mind, 10 Montieth invites residents into a ground-breaking world of accessibility and connectivity, one that celebrates user experience and champions shared perspective. Encapsulating one full block in Brooklyns coveted Bushwick neighborhood, 10 Montieths distinct modular form holds studio, one, and two-bedroom apartments at affordable and market rates, each pixelating the buildings faade with cascading terraces. Here, living space extends beyond each apartments four walls with ample outdoor space: the sloping rooftop garden is primed for group activities or moments of solitude while the inner courtyards serve as unexpected urban retreats.

Where most residential buildings play it safe, 10 Montieth breaks the mold. The O-shaped height is lowered in key areas to increase sunlight exposure for the courtyard and interior facades while tethering the building to the community with a scaled down vertical footprint. Similarly, the sloped roof creates unique points of access from the top levels of the building and the structures shape allows for views of Manhattan from street-facing and inner courtyard apartments. A living, breathing canvas of expression for its residents and community, 10 Montieth is the ideal address for New Yorks next wave of visionaries.

A grand foyer gallery, complete with marble powder room and large closet, welcomes you into this impressive 3,243-square-foot residence. Wide-plank hardwood floors line the home throughout while double-paned windows wrap the north, east and south of the residence. Enter the 31-foot long great room and you're greeted with custom double ethanol fireplaces and beautiful built-ins creating an intimate, cozy ambiance in the bright and airy space. Nearby, pocket doors unveil a large dining room that flows seamlessly into a state-of-the-art chef's kitchen outfitted with custom walnut cabinetry and marble countertops. Top-of-the-line appliances include a vented Viking six-burner cook-top, 2 Wolf ovens plus speed oven and warming drawer, 48-inch Sub-Zero refrigerator, 50-bottle Sub-Zero wine fridge and 2 Miele dishwashers.

The dramatic master suite features three custom closets, including two large walk-ins, and a tranquil spa-like bathroom outfitted in Bianco Dolomiti marble. Herringbone floors pave the space, and a freestanding soaking tub, separate walk-in shower and dual vanities are punctuated by LeFroy Brooks brushed nickel fixtures. The three additional bedroom suites each include custom closets and beautifully designed bathrooms, and the large laundry room with in-unit washer-dryer and utility sink is conveniently positioned nearby. Abundant smart home technology controls lighting, multi-zone central air conditioning, shades and invisible speakers, solidifying this home's position as a premier Tribeca residence where comfort and convenience meet impeccable style.
